intro: Selaginella monodii, commonly known as the "spikemoss," is a member of the Selaginellaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, needle-like leaves. It is a vascular plant that exhibits a unique reproductive system, producing both microspores and megaspores on the same plant. This species is typically found in moist, shaded environments, often in rocky or forested areas. Its life cycle includes a dominant gametophyte stage, which is a key feature of its evolutionary adaptation. Selaginella monodii is also noted for its ability to survive in arid conditions, making it a resilient plant in various habitats.
